title: Sydney, NSW traffic: Four trucks in fiery M1 crash, Metro delays
text:
Truck crash on the M1 near sparks Road, Halloran (central coast). Four trucks involved. It appears a B Double has crashed through a work site and taken out a barrier truck, Traffic control truck and a tipper. All trucks caught fire and started bush alight. M1 North bound is blocked and one South bound is open. Pictures TNV

Commuters from the Central Coast to Sydney are being told to expect significant delays after a fiery crash on the M1 and reported disruptions to the Metro.

Emergency services remain on the scene after a B-double travelling north through a roadworks zone on the M1 at Halloran ploughed into the back of a stationary truck, pushing it into another two roadworks trucks also stopped on the roadside.

“Five men have been taken to hospital; the driver suffered a shoulder injury and will also undergo mandatory testing, while four road workers were taken to be checked as a precaution and for treatment for the effects of shock,” police said.

Photographs of the wreckage show multiple charred vehicles with hollow and burnt-out cabins.

Emergency services are still on site so exercise caution & expect delays. pic.twitter.com/bhZ5Ed3n49 — Live Traffic NSW (@LiveTrafficNSW) October 29, 2019

The passing truck erupted in flames which spread to the other three heavy vehicles.

A major clean-up operation is ongoing involving police and Fire & Rescue NSW while an investigation into the crash is also underway.

Anyone who captured dashcam vision of the incident or of particular relevance should contact Wyong Police or Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.

Motorists are being advised to exercise caution and expect delays, Live Traffic NSW said.

Police urged road users to follow the directions of traffic crews.

Meanwhile, those travelling on the Sydney Metro were warned of “extended wait times” this morning.

Does this constitute a break down, and therefore should the counter be reset? Given the time of day, it can't be related to yesterday's fire alarm at Macquarie Uni. #sydneytrains #sydneymetro pic.twitter.com/2DtsdseqZo — Sydney Metro - Is it Working Today? (@SydneyMetroIIWT) October 29, 2019

A spokesman for Sydney Metro told news.com.au there were minor delays on the Metro North West between 5.30am and 6.30am today.

“The morning peak ran to schedule with a train every four minutes,” he said.

Services were not stopping at Macquarie Park station last night due to a fire alarm.
description: Commuters from the Central Coast to Sydney are being told to expect significant delays after a fiery crash on the M1 and reported disruptions to the Metro.
